intro: Aperula oxyphylla, commonly known as the silverleaf aperula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a silvery or grayish underside, giving it its common name. Aperula oxyphylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
